org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.languages.cpp.codegen.utils

Class CppGenUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.languages.cpp.codegen.utils.CppGenUtils

  • public class CppGenUtils
extends Object
    Some utilities specific to C++ code generation: a set of static methods that is intended for use from Acceleo templates.
    Author:
    wassim, ansgar

      Return a kind of qualifiedName, except if - The named element has the stereotype External or NoCodeGen - The named element is part of the ANSI C library - The named element is a primitive type that has no further definition via a stereotype (TODO: why is this required/useful?)

      • getStdtypes

        public static String getStdtypes(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.PrimitiveType type)
        The standard UML and MARTE libraries do not apply the stereotype "Typedef". Yet, we want to treat these types in an identical way, i.e. we use a typedef to the associated primitive C++ type
        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • resetVisibility

        public static void resetVisibility(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.VisibilityKind v)
        Update the current visibility to the specified value without writing this value to the output. This is to be used when setting the default visibility of a class/struct.

      • getCurrentVisibility

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.VisibilityKind getCurrentVisibility()
        Get the current visibility so we can restore it when generating nested classes

      • getSection

        public static String getSection(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.VisibilityKind visibility,
                                String content)
        Create a section of code with the appropriate visibility. Merges the content with the previously declared visibility (if appropriate). Ignore empty content.
